abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio defends his policies to address homelessness in interview on MSNBC and rejects assertion that he has ignored issue; de Blasio has faced public outcry, and disputes negative characterizations of his policies that have been offered up by former Mayor Rudolph W Giuliani.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and BENJAMIN MUELLER

lead_paragraph: In an interview with Joe Scarborough, New York’s mayor added, “What I think I have to do better is explain the origins of this problem and show people what we’re doing about it.”

headline.main: Mayor de Blasio Says Homeless Problem Is ‘Decades Old’
headline.print_headline: De Blasio, Facing Outcry, Defends Homeless Policy
